rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Actors that are human beings. Note that film.nonhuman_actor is for actors that are not human beings, e.g. Lassie.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film actor to the date on which the film career of the actor ended.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: End of Career

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates an actor to a film in which the actor has appeared. Note that this property should eventually be elevated to film.person_or_entity_appearing_in_film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a film actor to information about onscreen romances involving characters played by the actor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Romantic Relationship

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property linking an actor to a particular performance of the actor in a film. Note that this property should eventually be elevated to film.person_or_entity_appearing_in_film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film actor to the date on which the film career of the actor began.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Start of Career

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who is responsible for the overall look of a film, i.e. the style of the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Art Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who is responsible for assigning roles in a film to actors.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Casting Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all film characters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film character to a movie in which the character has appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film character to information about which movies the character appeared in and who played the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who manages the lighting and camera crews for a film shoot and has overall responsibility for image quality of a movie.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Cinematographer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a cinematographer to a film in which the cinematographer is credited.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film
Film collection
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not used, and it's not clear how its meaning differs from film.series. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.series]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A company that specializes in making movies, e.g. Paramount Studios.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Company
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type apparently has the same meaning as film.production_company. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.production_company]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film-Film company relationship
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not necessary. The property film.film.production_company can be used to relate a film to the company that produced it. Furthermore, most of the properties on this type are relevant to a film and not to the company that produced it. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.film.production_company]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film company
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type film.company_relationship has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film cut
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type film.company_relationship has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type film.company_relationship has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film cut
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type film.company_relationship has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Role/service
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type film.company_relationship has been deprecated. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for the functions that people can perform in a film company, e.g. sound effects editor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Company Role
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type appears to have the same intended meaning as film.job_role. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.job_role]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A relationship type that allows an assessment of suitability to be assigned to a film, e.g. PG, PG-13, R, etc. Note that this type is used for formal, institutional ratings of film content. Use ratings.rated_entity for informal reviews and ratings created by ordinary users.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Enter the minimum adult-accompanied age that this rating allows
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Minimum Accompanied Age

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Enter the minimum unaccompanied age that this rating allows
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Minimum Unaccompanied Age

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A classification system of descriptors assigned to films to indicate the appropriate audience for the content, e.g. the British Board of Film Classification.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Rating System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who is responsible for designing the costumes that are used in a film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Costumer Designer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that represents the ranking of a particular country of origin for a given film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country Ranking

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the country that has the given ranking in the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the ranking of the country of origin, represented as a decimal, in the given film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ranking

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who specializes in some aspect of behind-the-camera film production.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Crewmember

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Someone who specializes in analyzing and evaluating films.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Critic

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The final, edited version of a given film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Cut
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: A film cut and a film release are just versions of a film. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.release]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A person who has overall creative responsibility for a movie.
Things that are film directors:
## A person who directs a film for theatrical release (e.g. feature film directors Blake Edwards, Penny Marshall, and Pedro Almodovar).
## A person who directs a film for television (e.g. ESPN documentary film "Kings Ransom" director Peter Berg and HBO film "Grey Gardens" director Michael Sucsy).
## A person who directs a film for direct-to-home video presentation (e.g. straight-to-DVD "Tinkerbell" director Bradley Raymond).
## A person who directs a film for streaming on the internet (e.g. 30 Second Bunnies short film director Jennifer Shiman).
Things that are NOT film directors:
## Film producers who control the business side of the production (e.g. Frank Marshall, Andrew MacDonald). Use mso:film.producer in these cases.
## Art Directors (e.g. Etienne Rohde). Use mso:film.art_director in these cases.
## Directors of photography (e.g. Edward Lachman). Use mso:film.cinematographer in these cases.
## Casting directors (e.g. Heike Brandstatter). Use mso:film.casting_director in these cases.
## Assistant directors, technical directors, and other directors of a specific area of the film-making process (e.g. Ted Fay, Bill Houston Ball). Use mso:film.crewmember in these cases.
## A person who directs non-film television program episodes or segments(e.g. Arlene Sanford). Use mso:tv.director in these cases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film director to one of the films that he or she directed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the distribution of a film release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Distribution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the type of release of the film, e.g. Director's Cut or Theatrical Release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the medium of distribution, e.g. DVD or Internet.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Distribution Medium

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the company that is distributing the film release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Distributor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the given film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the film release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the location where the film release is distributed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Region

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the year when the film release is distributed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Year

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for media where a film can be presented, e.g. DVD, TV, Internet, Theatrical, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Distribution Medium

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A company that distributes movies.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Distributor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a company to a film that is distributed by the company.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about which actors provide the voice for which characters and in which languages in a film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Dubbing Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the actor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the film character for which the actor provides the voice.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the language in which the actor provides the voice for the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who is responsible for assembling the various shots created in film-making into a coherent sequence.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Editor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film editor to a film in which the editor is credited.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film
Film featured song
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not necessary. Just use film.film_song. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.film_song]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The film this song was either created specifically for (or played a significant role within the film).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Featured in film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A recurring event where multiple films are screened, usually in the same general location. For example, Cannes Film Festival is an example of film.festival, and Cannes Film Festival 2014 is an example of film.festival_event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Festival

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film festival to the date that the film festival was first held.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date Founded

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film festival to the genre of films that this festival screens. Note that not all festivals have a focus.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Focus

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film festival to the overall location (e.g. a city or region) where the festival is held. Note that screening venues should not be entered using this property. Use film.film_festival_event.venue for that.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Location

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film festival to an organization or person that sponsored the festival.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Festival Sponsor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An instance of a recurring film festival. For example, the Cannes Film Festival 2014 is an instance of mso:film.festival_event, and the Cannes Film Festival is an instance of mso:film.festival.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Festival Event

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film festival event to the last film shown at the event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Closing Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The film festival that this is an occurrence of.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Festival

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film festival event to a film that was shown at the event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a festival event to the number of films that were shown at the event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Films

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film festival event to the first film shown at the event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Opening Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film festival event to a venue that was used in the film festival event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Venue
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: This property is not needed, because mso:film.venue is a parent type of mso:film.festival_event. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film festival focus
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: There is no need to have a special type for the topic of a film festival, given the degree of overlap with film.genre. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.genre]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film festival sponsor
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: There is no need to have a special type for agents that sponsor films, since any agent could conceivably sponsor a film. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:event.agent]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film festival sponsorship
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not needed. The property film.festival.sponsor can be used to relate directly a film festival to a sponsor. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.festival.sponsor]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The name of the festival being sponsored.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Festival
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The property film.festival.sponsor can be used to relate directly a film festival to a sponsor. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.festival.sponsor]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The group that organized the festival.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sponsor
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The property film.festival.sponsor can be used to relate directly a film festival to a sponsor. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.festival.sponsor]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
Primary entity representing the collection of all films. This is the form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement. A film can be of any length of running time and presented in a theatrical, television, internet-streaming or direct-to-home video presentation.
Things that are films:
## Theatrical film releases (e.g. The Wizard of Oz, Singin In The Rain, Seven Samurai, Battleship Potemkin, M, Le Fabuleux Destin d'Am??lie Poulain, and Y Tu Mam?? Tambi??n).
## Musical concert films, often a special broadcast on a TV network, straight-to-video release or a special film event presentation (e.g. Jonas Brothers: The 3D Concert Experience or Yanni Live at the Royal Hall).
## Educational, promotional or institutional/corporate films (e.g. Duck and Cover, Your Safety First, and Your Name Here).
##Other visual media edited and re-released as a film. (e.g. Fanny & Alexander, The Kingdom).
##TV movies (e.g. 12 Angry Men, Grey Gardens and A Time For Miracles).
##Direct-To-Video films: (e.g. Stitch! The Movie).
##Online video film productions (e.g. 405 and Alive in Joburg).
##Short films, duration of anywhere from a minute to 40 minutes in North America and much shorter elsewhere (e.g.: La Jetee, The Battle of San Pietro).
##Cartoons often shown before the main title in the early to mid-20th century (e.g.: What's Opera Doc?, Presto).
Things that are NOT films:
## TV series (e.g.: Gilligan's Island, Mahabharat, Lost). In this case, the type mso:tv.program should be used.
## TV Miniseries. These are TV Programs with a very small number of episodes presented over a short period of time and never re-edited and re-released as a film later (e.g. Roots, Shogun and Rich Man, Poor Man). Use tv.program in these cases.
## Music videos and music video compilations. These may resemble films in having actors, dialogue, and plot, but are almost always intended to promote a music single/album.
##Film series. These are series of closely related films (e.g.: Looney Tunes, Three Colors, Otoko wa Tsurai yo, and the James Bond film series). Use mso:film.series in these cases.
##Film trailers. These are considered promotional material, and thus are an advertisement.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film to one of the actors appearing in the film. Note that the actors related by the property can be either human or nonhuman actors.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to its art director.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Art Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the ratio of the width to the height of the images making up the film. Note that the expected type of this property should eventually be changed to mso:measurement_unit.integer_ratio.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Aspect Ratio

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the person responsible for casting the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Casting Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film to one of the characters appearing in the film. Note that the characters can be played by either human or nonhuman actors.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to its cinematographer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cinematographer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that indicates whether the film is or is not in color. Note that this property should eventually be changed to a Boolean.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Color

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the person responsible for the overall design of costumes of the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Costume Designer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to its country of origin.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film to the date on which the film was released in its country of origin.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country Release Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a film to information about the ranking of the countries of origin for the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country Ranking

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a film to the final, edited version of the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Cut

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to its director.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:film.film to the mso:film.distribution relationship that collects the data for the film's distribution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Distribution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to its editor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Editor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to a dated money value representing the estimated budget for the film at the given point in time.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Estimated Budget

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the head producer for the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Executive Producer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:film.film to a prominent song in the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Featured Song

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a film to a film in the same series as the given film. For example, it would like "The Empire Strikes Back" to "Return of the Jedi".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film in Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the start and end dates for the shooting of the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Filming

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to a standard descriptor for one of its release formats, e.g. IMAX or Kinemacolor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Format

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to a general category describing the form, style or subject matter of the film, e.g. science fiction, romance, thriller, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a film to information about the ranking of the genres represented in the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre Ranking

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Mistake description
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Goof
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The intended meaning of this property is not clear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the total proceeds of the film in its US release by the given date.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gross Revenue

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the date that the film was released into the first market where the film was distributed. Note that film.release.date records the date that the film was released into a particular market - film.release.region.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Initial Release Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to one of the original or primary languages of the film. Note that the property film.release.release_language should be used for dubbed/subtitled languages of a film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to one of the major locations where the film was shot/produced.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Featured Locations

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to a music artist that was involved in the production of the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Music
Parent film
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The meaning of this property is not clear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film to information about the actors who appear in the film and the roles that they play there.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a film to a comprehensive description of the plot of the film, in some cases including "spoilers". Note that this property is intended to be used for plot descriptions that are longer than a single paragraph. For shorter plot summaries, the property mso:film.film.synopsis should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Plot

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the start and end dates for the post-production (effects, editing, scoring etc.) of the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Post-production

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the start and end dates of the film's pre-production (includes all phases of development for the film) before actual filming began.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pre-production

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to another film that precedes it in a series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Prequel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to someone who is credited as a producer of the film. Note that this property is not meant for executive, associate, or assistant producers. There is a dedicated property for executive producers, and associated/assistant producers should be entered as crewmembers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Producer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to one of the companies responsible for producing the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Production Company

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the date that production of the film was finished. Note that film.film.initial_release_date records the first date that the film was released anywhere, and film.release.date records the date that the film was released into a particular market - film.release.region.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Production Complete Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The lead production designer(s) responsible on the film production
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Production design by
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use film.film.art_director instead. In the context of film-making, an art director is the same as a production designer. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.film.art_director]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to a popular quotation from the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Quotation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to a content rating for the film, e.g. PG, PG-13, R, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film to one of its releases.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film to the runtime in minutes of one of its releases. Note that the virtual properties need to be redefined in terms of film.release.runtime.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Runtime in Minutes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to another film that follows it in a series.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sequel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to a series of which it is a part, e.g. the film "The Empire Strikes Back" is part of the "Star Wars" series of films.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the set designer of the film. Note that assistant and associate set designers should be entered as crewmembers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Set Designer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a movie to a showtime at a theater where the movie will be shown.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Showtime

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film to information about songs or instrumental music played as part of the film, including music performed by members of the cast as part of their performances and incidental or background music.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Song
Film sound mix
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The intended meaning of this property is not clear. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film to a published recording of the music used in the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Soundtrack

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a film to a secondary writer of the screenplay of the film. Note that this property should be used for writers whose contributions were never included in the final shooting script for the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Story

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to one of its topics.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subject

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a film to a brief description of the plot of the film, in some cases including "spoilers". Note that this property is intended to be used for plot descriptions that are no longer than a single paragraph. For longer plot summaries, the property mso:film.film.plot should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Synopsis

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a film to a catchy phrase used to promote the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Tagline

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a film to a webpage where a trailer for the film can be viewed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Trailer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to a piece of text describing a brief, interesting fact about the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Trivia

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:film.film to the mso:media_common.video_offer that is a video of the given film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video of Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to an action of watching the film, either in a theater or on a personal device.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Watch Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to an action of watching a preview or trailer of the film, either in a theater or on a personal device.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Watch Preview

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to the domestic gross revenue of the film on opening weekend in the United States.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Opening Weekend Gross Revenue

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film to a person who has primary responsibility the screenplay of the film. The proper film.film.story should be used for people who made a minor contribution to the screenplay.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Screenplay Writer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about an onscreen romantic relationship between the characters played by two actors.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Romantic Relationship

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the actor whose character is involved in the given onscreen relationship.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the character that has the given onscreen romantic relationship.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the film in which the given onscreen romantic relationship takes place.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the actor that plays the partner of the given character in the onscreen romantic relationship.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Partner Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the character that is the partner of the given character in the onscreen romantic relationship.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Partner Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the type of romantic relationship between the two characters in the given film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Romantic Relationship Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A music composition that is featured prominently in a film, e.g. "Singing in the Rain".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Song

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film song to information about the performance of the song in films.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film
Film song performer
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not needed. Use music.artist instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:music.artist]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Songs (including instrumental music) recorded by this performer which were included in films, either as pre-recorded music or as part of the film itself.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film songs
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type of this property has been deprecated. If this property is needed, it should be added to music.artist. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about who performed a song in a particular movie.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Song Relationship

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the song or musical composition in the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Composition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the film in which the song appeared.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies a music artist that performed the song in the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for release formats of films, e.g. IMAX or Kinemacolor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Format

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for the form, style or subject matter of a film, e.g. science fiction, romance, thriller, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a film genre to a film exemplifying the genre.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that represents the ranking of a particular genre in a given film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre Ranking

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the genre that has the given ranking in the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the ranking of the genre, represented as a decimal, in the given film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ranking

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about which people performed which crewmember jobs in a particular movie.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Crew Gig

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the crewmember.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Crewmember

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the role of the crewmember in the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Crew Role

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for the functions that people can perform in making a film, e.g. special effects and voice actor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Job

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that represents the ranking of a particular language in a given film. This type is useful when a film includes more than one language, and there is a need to indicate which languages are used more often than others.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language Ranking

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the language that has the given ranking in the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the ranking of the language, represented as a decimal, in the given film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ranking
Film music contributor
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not needed. Use music.artist instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:music.artist]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Actors that are not human beings, e.g. animals. Note that the type film.actors includes all actors, whether human or nonhuman, while film.human_actor includes only people.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Nonhuman Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about which actors play which characters and in which type of performance in a film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Performance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the actor, whether human or nonhuman (e.g. a trained animal).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Actor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the character played by the actor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the stage of a character played by an actor in a particular film performance. The use of this property is necessary when, and only when, different actors play different stages of a character's life in a movie, e.g. one plays the character as a young man and one plays the character as an old man.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character Note

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the order in which the actor appears in the credits of the movie for the given role.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Credits Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the film in which the actor plays the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the type of performance of the actor, e.g. voice actor, motion-capture model, appearance from archive footage, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all performance types. This includes performances in television, film, theater, and any other medium that has performances.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Performance Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A type containing people, animals, and other agents who have appeared in films. The role could be minor, like a cameo appearance, but it must be visible/audible in the film. Otherwise, the types mso:film.crewmember, mso:film.director, etc. should be used.
The following are instances of this type:
## Voice actors (e.g. Cameron Diaz, voice of Princess Fiona in the Shrek movies).
## Body doubles or stunt doubles (e.g. Rachel Grant, Angelina Jolie body double in Lara Croft: Tomb Raider).
## A person or animal that appears as himself/herself (e.g. Steve Carrell and James Franco in Knocked Up).
## Narrators (e.g. Morgan Freeman, narrator of March of the Penguins).
## Singers who record vocal tracks for an actor or actress in a film (e.g. Marni Nixon).
## Animals in a film (e.g.:= Pal, the original Lassie).
## Actors appearing in TV movies (e.g. Meredith Baxter in Down Will Come Baby).
## Groups of people (e.g. The Beatles in a Hard Day's Night).
The following are NOT instances of this type:
## Directors (e.g. Steven Spielberg). Use mso:film.director in these cases.
## Actors in television series (e.g. Jerry Seinfeld in Seinfeld). Use mso:tv.actor in these cases.
## Theatrical actors (e.g.:Kristin Chenoweth in the musical Wicked). Use mso:theater.actor in these cases.
## Documentary subjects (e.g. Stephen Hawking in A Brief History of Time, Timothy McVeigh in Bowling for Columbine and Koko the gorilla in Koko: A Talking Gorilla).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Person or Entity Appearing in Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates an actor, whether human or nonhuman, to a film in which the actor appears.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who is responsible for the business side of film-making, including securing financing for a film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Producer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a film producer to a film that he or she produced.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A company that specializes in making movies, e.g. Paramount Studios.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Production Company

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a production company to a film produced by the company.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film
Film production designer
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: Use film.art_director instead. In the context of film-making, an art director is the same as a production designer. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.art_director]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A particular version of the film whose distribution begins on certain date. Note that film.release includes film.film, because any of the properties of the original film can vary in a release of it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film release to the date it was released in the given region.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film release to the distribution medium of the release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Distribution Medium

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film release to the film of which it is a release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film release to the market where it was released.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Release Region

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film release to a language in which the film has been dubbed or subtitled for the release. Note that the property film.film.language should be used for the original/primary language(s) of the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Release Language

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film release to the length of the release in minutes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Runtime

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film release to a standard descriptor for its kind, e.g. the premiere, a rerelease, a limited release, an extended release, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Release Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film release to the venue where the release debuted in the given region.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Debut Venue

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration type containing standard descriptors for the kind of film release, e.g. the premiere, a rerelease, a limited release, an extended release, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Release Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A release of the film that does not incorporate enhanced depth perception, unlike 3D versions which typically need to be viewed with special glasses.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: 2D Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A release of the film that incorporates enhanced depth perception. Typically 3D versions of a film need to be viewed with special glasses.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: 3D Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enumeration value representing the release of the film in the country in which the film was made.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Country of Origin Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A release of the film that has a longer running time that the initial theatrical release, e.g. because deleted scenes were added back to the movie.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Extended Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The release of the film that is on the first DVD edition of the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Initial DVD Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A theatrical release of the film that is restricted to a relatively small range of markets.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Limited Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The initial theatrical release of the film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Premiere

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A theatrical release of the film that occurs after the initial release.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rerelease

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A rerelease of the film that incorporates scenes that were not part of the original movie shoot.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Special Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The initial release of a film to a large number of theaters across the nation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Wide Release

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A collection of films that can be integrated into a single, overarching plot and that feature overlapping characters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film series to the director of the film series. Note that this property should be used only when the entire series has the same director (or same set of directors).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Director

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film series, e.g. "Star Wars", to one of the films making up the series, e.g. "The Empire Strikes Back".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a film series to another film series that is narratively a predecessor of the first series. For example, the film series "Hobbit" is a prequel of the film series "The Lord of the Rings".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Prequel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film series to the producer of the film series. Note that this property should be used only when the entire series has the same producer (or same set of producers).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Producer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film series to another film series that is narratively a successor of the first series. For example, the film series "The Lord of the Rings" is a sequel of the film series "The Hobbit".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sequel

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person who is responsible for the sets and other decorative elements used in the film (other than costumes).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Set Decorator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:film.set_designer to the mso:film.films on which the designer worked.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that stores information about the times when a movie is shown at a theater.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Showtime

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a movie showtime to an act of purchasing a ticket for the showtime.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Buy Ticket

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a showtime to the movie that is shown in that slot.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates whether the showtime is a matinee, i.e. a showing of a movie in the morning or afternoon with a reduced price.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Matinee

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies an identifier for the room in the theater where the movie will be shown.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Screen Number
Show Date
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use time.event.start_date and time.event.end_date instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[time.event.end_date]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Show Times
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: It's not clear what this property is supposed to mean. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates that the given showtime is sold out, i.e. tickets for the showtime are no longer available for purchase.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Sold Out

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the movie theaters for which the showtime is valid.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Theater

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a movie showtime to an action of viewing the information about the showtime.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: View Showtime
Film story contributor
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: There is no need for this type. Use film.writer instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:film.writer]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all film subjects. These are the broad topics that a film may said to be 'about'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Subject

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A permanent venue where movies are shown.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Theater

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a theater to the price of an adult ticket for a standard showing of a film at the theater.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Adult Price

rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: It's not clear what this property means. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a theater to the price of a ticket for minors at a standard showing of a film at the theater.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Child Price
Listening
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: It's not clear what this property is supposed to mean. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Market
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: It's not clear what this property is supposed to mean. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Movie line
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: Use type.object.webpage for the webpages associated with the film.theater. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:type.object.webpage]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a theater to a number indicating how many screens are in the theater. Note that this property applies only to multiplex theaters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Screens

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film theater to a descriptor for a seating configuration offered by the theater, e.g. reclining seats, couches, stadium seating, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Seating

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a theater to the price of a ticket for senior citizens at a standard showing of a film at the theater.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Senior Price

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a movie theater to one of the showtimes for the theater, i.e. one of the times when a movie will be shown at the theater.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Showtime

rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: It's not clear what this property is supposed to mean. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A specialist, particularly an academic specialist, who develops theories about film and its relation to society and the arts.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Theorist

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about vouchers that entitle the bearers to attend a screening of a film.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ticket

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a film ticket to the showtime for which the ticket is valid.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Showtime

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all places where moves can be screened.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Screening Venue

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all video rental shops. These are the businesses that rent videos for home viewing.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Video Store

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
People who are credited who are credited with having written (part of) a screenplay for a film. Sometimes multiple people are credited even if their contributions were not included in the final shooting script for the film.
Things that are film writers:
## Writers credited with the creation of a film's screenplay (eg. David Mamet for House of Games, Quentin Tarantino for Pulp Fiction, Guillermo del Toro for Pan's Labyrinth).
## Writers who both wrote the screenplay and the work from which the screenplay was adapted (e.g. Ayn Rand for The Fountainhead, Mario Puzo for The Godfather).
##Writers who wrote for a made-for-TV-movie or a TV program/TV show subsequently presented as a film or TV movie (e.g. Ingmar Bergman for Fanny & Alexander, Lars von Trier for The Kingdom).
##The writer of the work the film is based upon but who didn't write the screenplay (e.g. William Shakespeare for Romeo + Juliet, Jules Verne for 20,000 Leagues Under The Sea, and Wu Cheng'en for The Forbidden Kingdom).
##Playwrights who wrote plays that were the basis for a film (eg. Anton Chekhov for plays such as Uncle Vanya).
Things that are NOT film writers:
##TV writers (e.g. Aaron Sorkin for the pilot episode of the West Wing). In these cases, mso:tv.writer should be used.
##Authors who did not write books that were the basis of films (e.g. Jean-Paul Sartre, writer of The Age of Reason). In these cases, mso: book.author should be used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film Writer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a screenwriter to a film for which he or she wrote the screenplay.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Film
